div.a: FES BRAVES TRIP May 8, , 8:30 AM — 2:30 PM
View All News
New FISD Superintendent

div.span: The Frankston ISD Board of Trustees officially appointed Nicci Cook as the new superintendent in a special board meeting on April 15th. Nicci Cook is a former graduate of Frankston ISD and a longtime resident of the community. She has been with the district since 2003 and has served as the assistant superintendent for the past 10 years. In those years, Mrs. Cook has shown great leadership and commitment to the district, and we would like to congratulate her on her new position as Frankston ISD ...

a.title: Click to read more about: New FISD Superintendent

div.a: Read More about New FISD Superintendent
Support FISD FFA Students

div.span: As most people know, the April 19 – 23, 2020 Anderson County Youth Livestock Show was canceled due to the Coronavirus. Our Ag students have worked very hard on projects that unfortunately, they will not be able to show. The Anderson County Youth Livestock Association would like to ask you to support ACYLA in establishing a “pool” of funds that will be distributed among the exhibitors. See a list of our students and projects below along with links for anyone who wishes to ...

COVID-19 Update

div.span: Frankston ISD remains in regular contact with local, state and federal health officials for the latest information and will continue to provide updates to the community as needed. At this location you will find information about Frankston ISD’s response and plans related to Coronavirus, including links to helpful information.

a.title: Click to read more about: COVID-19 Update

div.a: Read More about COVID-19 Update
Middle School/High School Packet 2

div.span: Middle school and high school packet 2 distribution will begin Monday, April 13th, at 10am. Packets will be available under the awning ouside the middle school gym and any packets not picked up by 4pm will be moved to the pick up bins. All student work should be returned to the appropriate crates in the high school foyer.

a.title: Click to read more about: Middle School/High School Packet 2

div.a: Read More about Middle School/High School Packet 2
Meal Delivery Schedule

div.span: Due to circumstances surrounding the Coronavirus, Frankston ISD will be delivering meals on Mondays and Thursdays only for the month of April. Monday's delivery will include breakfast and lunch for Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. Thursday's delivery will include breakfast and lunch for Thursday and Friday. See locations below.

a.title: Click to read more about: Meal Delivery Schedule

div.a: Read More about Meal Delivery Schedule
Student Packet Schedule

div.span:
Student work packet schedule for the coming weeks:
Packet 2 --
Pick Up on April 13th and
Return by April 23rd
Packet 3--
Pick Up on April 27th and
Return by May 7th.
All middle school and high school packets will be picked up from bins outside MS gym and returned to crates in the HS foyer.
Elementary packets will be picked up and dropped off in the elementary foyer.

em.span: Frankston Independent School District fosters a community of life-long learners by providing an environment that builds self-worth, integrity, and respect for diversity while striving for academic and social excellence.

span.span: Frankston ISD Athletics offers student-athletes opportunities to compete in exceptional athletic programs. We have high standards with regard to sportsmanship and conduct and our student-athletes are able to quickly learn and grow their teamwork, discipline, and dedication skills. Our focus is on what we can accomplish together and how each member of our department can fulfill their role to the utmost. By doing so, we feel that group achievement will be a byproduct of our total team effort. We highly encourage prospective and current students to take advantage of the excellent sports teams that are offered at FISD.

Frankston Independent School District
100 Perry Street
Frankston, Texas 75763
